I could at the time see 2 options. One was to blunt the queen's attack line with 12...g6, and after 13.Nxf6 Qxf6 White has no attack left. Or I could have played a "waiting move" - I had 12...Bd7 in mind - and Black's position is sound.

I could at the time see 2 options. One was to blunt the queen's attack line with 12...g6, and after 13.Nxf6 Qxf6 White has no attack left. Or I could have played a "waiting move" - I had 12...Bd7 in mind - and Black's position is sound.
Ah. Perhaps I should have gone for the waiting move. White's queen has an unobstructed attack line, so I decided to take the bishop, which would give me a win IF White's attack failed.
